abstract: A start-up called Truth on Call lets reporters, financial analysts, pharmaceutical executives and, soon, patients, text questions to a group of doctors.
snippet: A start-up called Truth on Call lets reporters, financial analysts, pharmaceutical executives and, soon, patients, text questions to a group of doctors.
lead_paragraph: Patients, journalists, financial analysts, pharmaceutical executives and doctors could at times benefit from having a panel of physicians to whom they could pose questions. Truth On Call, a San Francisco start-up, assembles such a group virtually, by letting people text questions to physicians and then collecting the doctors’ responses.

headline.main: Have a Medical Question? Text a Group of Doctors
